isis.stitle: TSI 08-12-09 - Installation of Lower Crankcase Seals

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to International® VT 275 Diesel Engines, 2005-up Model Years; International® VT 365 Diesel Engines, 2002-2003 Model Years; International® VT 365 Diesel Engines, 2004-2006 Model Years; International® MaxxForce™ 5 Diesel Engines, 2007-up Model Years; and International® MaxxForce™ 7 Diesel Engines, 2007-up Model Years.
This installation procedure for new seals includes application of Loctite® 515 to prevent leaks between the lower and upper crankcase.

regulation.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) may be a hazard to human health and the environment. Handle all fluids and other contaminated materials (e.g. filters, rags) in accordance with applicable regulations. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids, filters, and other contaminated materials according to applicable regulations.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the application service manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner, and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

step1.para: See procedures in Engine Service Manual. Mount engine on stand: remove lower oil pan, upper oil pan, front cover, and rear cover.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Installation of Crankshaft Timing Tool ZTSE4519 (VT 365, 2002-2006)
Figure 2. Installation of Crankshaft Timing Tool ZTSE4687 (VT 275, 2005-up and MaxxForce™ 5, 2007-up)
Figure 3. Crankshaft and camshaft timing marks (MaxxForce™ 7, 2007-up)

step1.para: Bar engine over and set engine timing alignment.

note.para: To set engine timing alignment, do one of the following:

item.para: Align crankshaft and camshaft timing marks (Figure 3).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Outer lower crankcase bolts and main bearing bolts (VT 365, 2002-2003)
Figure 5. Main bearing bolts (VT 365, 2004-2006 and MaxxForce™ 7, 2007-up)
Figure 6. Outer lower crankcase bolts and main bearing bolts (VT 275, 2005-up and MaxxForce™ 5, 2007-up)

calloutgroup.callout1: Outboard main bearing cap bolt (M14 x 114) (8)
Inboard main bearing cap bolt (M14 x 127) (8)

step1.para: Remove and discard inboard main bearing bolts (M14 x 127).
Remove and discard outboard main bearing bolts (M14 x 114).
Remove outer lower crankcase bolts (M8 x 30), if applicable.
Remove lower crankcase.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use permanent markers to identify internal components or their orientation. Do not use paint or temporary markers.

step1.para: Use a permanent marker to number main bearings, starting from front of engine.
Remove main bearings from lower crankcase by pushing bearings out from bearing saddles.
Inspect main bearings and put aside.
Remove and discard lower crankcase seals.
Clean mating surface, bearing surfaces, seal grooves, and bolt holes of lower crankcase.
Clean mating surface and rails of upper crankcase.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, clean and dry threads in the crankcase bolt holes with filtered compressed air. Dirt or oil in holes may cause binding and incorrect torque readings.

step1.para: Clean and dry threads, in upper crankcase bolt holes, with filtered compressed air.
Apply a small even amount of Loctite® 515 gasket eliminator in seal grooves.
Install new lower crankcase seals and clean excess Loctite® 515 gasket eliminator from crankcase surface.

note.para: When installing bearings, make sure oil is not between the backside of the bearings and lower crankcase bearing saddles.

step1.para: Install main bearings in lower crankcase as marked.
Lubricate bearings with clean engine oil.
Apply a light film of Loctite® 515 gasket eliminator to surface of upper crankcase.
Carefully position lower crankcase onto upper crankcase.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, install new main bearing bolts for lower crankcase assembly.
To prevent engine damage, install longer main cap bolts (M14 x 127) inboard and shorter main cap bolts (M14 x 114) outboard.

step1.para: Install, but do not torque inboard main bearing bolts (M14 x 127).
Install, but do not torque outboard main bearing bolts (M14 x 114).
Install, but do not torque outer lower crankcase bolts (M8 x 30), if applicable.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Torque sequence for main bearing bolts (VT 365, 2002-2006 and MaxxForce™ 7, 2007-up)
Figure 8. Torque sequence for main bearing bolts (VT 275, 2005-up and MaxxForce™ 5, 2007-up)

step1.para: Torque main bearing bolts in sequence as follows:

item.para: First - torque all bolts to 120 N·m (90 lbf·ft)
Second - torque all bolts to 163 N·m (120 lbf·ft)
Third - torque all bolts to 231 N·m (170 lbf·ft)

figure.caption: Figure 9. Torque sequence for outer lower crankcase bolts (VT 365, 2002-2003)
Figure 10. Torque sequence for outer lower crankcase bolts (VT 275, 2005-up and MaxxForce™ 5, 2007-up)

step1.para: Torque outer M8 x 30 bolts in sequence to 31 N·m (23 lbf·ft), if applicable.
Remove Crankshaft Timing Tool, if installed.
See Engine Service Manual. Install rear cover, front cover, upper oil pan, and lower oil pan.
